H0.text: Radiant to nuclear is the energy transformation that most likely occurred when a student’s breakfast provided energy for bicycling later in the day.

H1.text: Chemical to nuclear energy transformation most likely occurred when the breakfast that a student ate provided energy for bicycling later in the day.

H2.text: Radiant to mechanical is the energy transformation that most likely occurred when the breakfast a student ate provided the energy for bicycling later in the day.

H3.text: Chemical to mechanical energy transformation most likely occurred when the breakfast the student ate provided energy for bicycling later in the day.

A4.text: Chemical energy in the fuel is converted into kinetic energy of expanding gas via combustion

A5.text: ATP hydrolysis (chemical energy in adenosine triphosphate → mechanical energy)
